data: Upper Marshdale | police-station | waste land | solitary fields

The church-clock of that small country place, Upper Marshdale, was chiming half-past nine on a dark night, as the local inspector turned out of the police-station and made his way with a fleet step across a piece of waste land and some solitary fields beyond it.
The Story of Charles Strange: A Novel. Vol. 2
